“Are you sure about him?” Pulcheria Alexandrovna asked, trembling.

“I’m on guard,” Pyotr Petrovitch replied. “I’m discovering where he’s lodging.”

“Oh, you frighten me! I thought him terrible! He caused Marfa Petrovna’s death.”

“Impossible to be certain. He may have accelerated events,” Pyotr said. 

“He’s depraved. Marfa loved him. She paid his debts.”

“Good heavens!” Pulcheria gasped. Raskolnikov listened closely.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses her fear of a man she believes caused Marfa Petrovna's death, while Pyotr Petrovitch describes him as depraved and dangerous, hinting at his criminal past.
